title: Exploring scenarios
text: plot biomass densities species model Figure 2 paper: following plot includes target species listed Table 1 paper:
code: plotlySpectra(NWMed_params, resource = FALSE, ylim = c(1e-10, NA)) target = c("Red mullet", "Striped red mullet", "Hake", "Angler fish",             "Poor cod", "Horse mackerel", "Blue whiting",            "Horned octopus", "Shortfin squid") nontarget = c("Starfish", "Murex", "Angular crab", "Harbour crab",             "Black goby", "Large DF worms", "Small DF crustacea",            "Endobenthic pred. crustacea", "Endobenthic pred. worms")  plotlySpectra(NWMed_params, resource = FALSE, species = target, ylim = c(1e-7, NA))

title: Exploring scenarios
text: Feel free change parameters explore effect results. Parameters affecting carrion detritus dynamics: reproduction level affects sensitivity species changes fishing. set value species can supply vector different values different species.
code: detritus_lifetime(NWMed_params) <- 1 carrion_lifetime(NWMed_params) <- 1/365 carrion_human_origin(NWMed_params) <- 0.2 NWMed_params <- setBevertonHolt(NWMed_params, reproduction_level = 0.5)

title: Exploring scenarios
text: First explore effect changing selective net, parameters Table 3 paper. project 15 years future fishing new gear unchanged effort. plot biomasses Yields target species, Figure 3 paper:  Alternatively one can look relative change biomass yield time: relative change biomass non-target species:
code: # Change selectivity ---- params_s <- NWMed_params gear_params(params_s)["Hake, Main", c("l25", "l50")] <- c(18, 21.5) gear_params(params_s)["Red mullet, Main", c("l25", "l50")] <- c(15.13, 17.28) gear_params(params_s)["Striped red mullet, Main", c("l25", "l50")] <- c(15.13, 17.28) gear_params(params_s)["Angler fish, Main", c("l25", "l50")] <- c(14, 18) gear_params(params_s)["Poor cod, Main", c("l25", "l50")] <- c(8.1, 9.5) gear_params(params_s)["Horse mackerel, Main", c("l25", "l50")] <- c(15.2, 17) gear_params(params_s)["Blue whiting, Main", c("l25", "l50")] <- c(18.8, 22.25) gear_params(params_s)["Shortfin squid, Main", c("l25", "l50")] <- c(14.2, 16.5) gear_params(params_s)["Horned octopus, Main", c("l25", "l50")] <- c(14.2, 16.5) sim_s <- project(params_s, t_max = 15, t_save = 0.1) p_bio <- mizer::plotBiomass(sim_s, species = target)  yield <- plotYield(sim_s, species = target, return_data = TRUE) yield_initial <- data.frame(Year = rep(-1, length(target)),                             Yield = getYield(NWMed_params)[target],                             Species = target) p_yield <- plotDataFrame(rbind(yield_initial, yield), NWMed_params,                          ylab = "Yield [g/yr]")  p_bio + p_yield + plot_layout(guides = 'collect') plotlyBiomassRelative(sim_s, species = target) plotlyYieldRelative(sim_s, NWMed_params, species = target) plotlyBiomassRelative(sim_s, species = nontarget)

title: Exploring scenarios
text: now implement landing obligation discarding taking place Hake Red mullet. project scenario 15 years future. leads minor change biomasses target species, shown Figure 4 paper: change species also small:
code: params_d <- NWMed_params species_params(params_d)["Hake", "discard"] <- 0 species_params(params_d)["Red mullet", "discard"] <- 0 sim_d <- project(params_d, t_max = 15, t_save = 0.1) plotlyBiomassRelative(sim_d, species = target) plotlyBiomassRelative(sim_d, species = nontarget)

title: Exploring scenarios
text: reduce fishing effort 40%, also reduces gear mortality percentage, project 15 years future. plot projected biomasses yield target species reduction fishing effort Figure 5 paper:  can look relative change: Figure 6 display relative change biomasses non-target species:
code: params_e <- NWMed_params initial_effort(params_e) <- 0.6 species_params(params_e)$gear_mort <- species_params(NWMed_params)$gear_mort * 0.6 sim_e <- project(params_e, t_max = 15, t_save = 0.1) p_bio <- mizer::plotBiomass(sim_e, species = target)  yield <- plotYield(sim_e, species = target, return_data = TRUE) yield_initial <- data.frame(Year = rep(-1, length(target)),                             Yield = getYield(NWMed_params)[target],                             Species = target) p_yield <- plotDataFrame(rbind(yield_initial, yield), NWMed_params,                          ylab = "Yield [g/yr]")  p_bio + p_yield + plot_layout(guides = 'collect') plotlyBiomassRelative(sim_e, species = target) plotlyYieldRelative(sim_e, NWMed_params, species = target) plotlyBiomassRelative(sim_e, species = nontarget)

title: Model description
text: Consumers can grow consuming prey (including possibly carrion detritus), discounting losses due metabolic processes. Predation includes model predator-prey encounter rate model rate consumption. Taking account rate metabolic losses, resulting energy intake can partitioned model energy allocated reproduction energy allocated somatic growth.

title: Model description
text: rate \(E_{}(w)\) predator species \(\) weight \(w\) encounters food (mass per time) obtained summing prey species integrating prey sizes \(w_p\), weighted selectivity factors described (relevant) adding encounter rates \(E_{C.}\) carrion \(E_{D.}\) detritus: \[   E_{}(w) = \gamma_i(w) \int \sum_{j} \theta_{ij} N_j(w_p)   \phi_i(w,w_p) w_p \, dw_p + E_{C.}(w) + E_{D.}(w). \] encounter rates carrion detritus described later. overall prefactor \(\gamma_i(w)\) sets predation power predator. interpreted search volume attack rate. default assumed scale allometrically \(\gamma_i(w) = \gamma_i\, w^{3/4}.\) order \(E_i(w)\) units grams per year, prefactor \(\gamma_i\) unit \(\text{grams}^{-3/4}\) per year. \(\theta_{ij}\) matrix sets interaction strength predator species \(\) prey species \(j\). size selectivity encoded predation kernel \(\phi_i(w,w_p)\). predator species use lognormal predation kernel given \[ \phi_i(w, w_p) = \exp \left[ \frac{-(\ln(w / w_p / \beta_i))^2}{2\sigma_i^2} \right] \] \(w/w_p\) larger 1 zero otherwise. \(\beta_i\) preferred predator-prey mass ratio \(\sigma_i\) determines width kernel. species use power-law kernel sigmoidal cutoffs given \[\phi_i(w, w_p) = \frac{(w/w_p)^s}{\left(1+e^{l_l}\frac{w_p}{w}\right)^{u_l} \left(1+e^{-l_r}\frac{w}{w_p}\right)^{u_r}}. \] parameters \(l_l\) \(u_l\) determine sigmoidal cutoff low predator/prey mass ratio \(l_r\) \(u_r\) similarly determine cutoff large predator/prey mass ratio.

title: Model description
text: Skip Consumption predator/prey interaction matrix entries equal either 0 (species can interact) 1, see @fig-interaction. Species interaction matrix parameters predation kernels estimated stomach data physical characteristics species. species use lognormal predation kernel, parameters given table . values detritivores chosen access detritus throughout life. species use truncated power law predation kernel. parameters :

title: Model description
text: encountered food consumed subject standard Holling functional response type II represent satiation. determines feeding level \(f_i(w)\), dimensionless number 0 (food) 1 (fully satiated) \(1-f_i(w)\) proportion encountered food consumed. feeding level given \[   f_i(w) = \frac{E_i(w)}{E_i(w) + h_i(w)}, \] \(h_i(w)\) maximum consumption rate predator species \(\) weight \(w\). default assume allometric form \(h_i(w) = h_i\, w^n\) \(n=0.7\). unit coefficients \(h_i\) \(\text{grams}^{1-n}\) per year. rate food consumed predator species \(\) weight \(w\) \[ (1-f_i(w))E_{}(w)=f_i(w)\, h_i(w). \] proportion \(\alpha_i\) consumed biomass retained, proportion \(1-\alpha_i\) expelled form feces, contribute detritus.

title: Model description
text: Skip Metabolic losses values coefficients \(h_i\) maximum consumption rates chosen feeding level fish experience reasonable value fish neither starved totally satiated.

title: Model description
text: food consumed used fuel needs metabolism, activity movement, rate \(\mathtt{metab}_i(w)\). default made standard metabolism, scaling exponent \(p\), loss due activity movement, scaling exponent \(1\): \[ \mathtt{metab}_i(w) = k_{s.}\,w^p + k_i\,w. \] units coefficients \(k_{s.}\) \(\text{grams}^{1-p}\) per year units \(k_i\) grams per year. remaining energy, , available growth reproduction, rate \[   E_{r.}(w) = \max(0, \alpha_i f_i(w)\, h_i(w) - \mathtt{metab}_i(w)) \]

title: Model description
text: proportion \(\psi_i(w)\) energy available growth reproduction used reproduction. proportion changes zero weight \(w_{m.}\) maturation one asymptotic weight \(w_{\infty.}\), available energy used reproduction. expression \[ \psi_i(w) = \begin{cases} \left[1+\left(\frac{w}{w_{mat}}\right)^{-U}\right]^{-1} \left(\frac{w}{w_{inf}}\right)^{m-n}&w<w_{inf}\\ 1&w\geq w_{inf}\end{cases} \] \(m-n = 0.3\) \(U=10\) (sets steepness sigmoidal switch-reproduction around maturity weight \(w_{mat}\)).

text: left metabolism reproduction taken account invested somatic growth. Thus growth rate individual species \(\) weight \(w\) \[   g_i(w) = E_{r.}(w)\left(1-\psi_i(w)\right). \] food supply cover requirements metabolism activity, growth reproduction stops, .e. negative growth.

Comparison model growth curves von Bertalanffy growth curves.

title: Model description
text: mortality rate \(\mu_i(w)\) individual species \(\) weight \(w\) four sources: predation mortality \(\mu_{p.}(w)\), background mortality \(\mu_{ext.}(w)\), fishing mortality \(\mu_{f.}(w)\) excess gear mortality \(\mu_{g.}\), combine \[ \mu_i(w)=\mu_{p.}(w)+\mu_{ext,}(w)+\mu_{f.}(w)+\mu_{g.}(w). \] now explain terms.

title: Model description
text: consumption fish translates corresponding predation mortalities ingested prey individuals. Recalling \(1-f_j(w)\) proportion food encountered predator species \(j\) weight \(w\) actually consumed, rate predators species \(j\) consume prey size \(w_p\) \[   \mathtt{pred\_rate}_j(w_p) = \int \phi_j(w,w_p) (1-f_j(w))   \gamma_j(w) N_j(w) \, dw. \] mortality rate due predation obtained \[   \mu_{p.}(w_p) = \sum_j \mathtt{pred\_rate}_j(w_p)\, \theta_{ji}. \]

title: Model description
text: External mortality \(\mu_{ext.}(w)\) independent abundances. default, mizer assumes external mortality species-specific constant \(z0_i\) independent size. value \(z0_i\) either specified species parameter assumed depend allometrically asymptotic size: \[ z0_i = z0_{pre} w_{\infty.}^{1-n}. \]

title: Model description
text: fishing mortality includes individuals hauled onto fishing vessel. Fishing gear also causes mortality among individuals encounter gear retained . mortality assumed size-specific. species parameter called gear_mort gives mortality rate individual imposed fishing gear. part gear mortality fishing mortality (.e., part individuals taken fishing vessel left dead sea) denote excess gear mortality. \[ \mu_{g.} = \max{\left(\mathtt{gear\_mort}_i - \mu_{f.}(w), 0\right)} \] excess gear mortality contributes carrion production.

title: Model description
text: total rate investment reproduction (grams/year) found integrating contribution individuals species \(\), invests proportion \(\psi_i(w)\) consumption. total rate energy investment can converted rate production offspring \(R_{p.}\) (numbers per year): \[   R_{p.} = \frac{\epsilon_i}{2 w_{min.}} \int N_i(w)  E_{r.}(w) \psi_i(w) \, dw. \] total rate investment multiplied efficiency factor \(\epsilon\) dividing offspring weight \(w_{min}\) convert energy number offspring. result multiplied factor \(1/2\) take account females contribute directly offspring. Note species pelagic phase size \(w_{min}\) size offspring join benthic ecosystem.

title: Model description
text: Three important density-dependent mechanisms widely assumed fisheries models automatically captured mizer model lead emergent stock-recruitment relationship: High density spawners leads reduced food income spawners consequently reduced per-capita reproduction. High density larvae leads slower growth larvae due food competition, exposing larvae high mortality longer time, thereby decreasing survivorship recruitment size. High density fish leads predation eggs fish larvae fish species cannibalism. However sources density dependence explicitly modelled mechanistically mizer. example limited carrying capacity suitable spawning grounds spatial effects. requires additional phenomenological density dependent contributions stock-recruitment. mizer type density dependence modelled constraints egg production survival. default functional form density dependence represented reproduction rate \(R_i\) (numbers per time) approaches maximum energy invested reproduction increases. described common Beverton-Holt type function used fisheries science: \[   R_i = R_{\max.} \frac{R_{p.}}{R_{p.} + R_{\max.}}, \] \(R_{\max.}\) maximum reproduction rate species \(\).

title: Model description
text: Skip Carrion reproduction parameters \(\epsilon_i\) \(R_{max.}\) directly observable. values instead chosen produce steady-state abundances species line observations give reasonable values reproduction level. next table gives steady-state reproduction level defined ratio actual reproduction rate \(R_i\) maximal possible reproduction rate \(R_{\max.}\).

title: Model description
text: Carrion (consisting dead individuals yet decomposed) important component ecosystem, providing food scavenger species. Feeding carrion scavengers size-based. Scavengers can feed carrion size. Therefore need describe carrion size spectrum need describe total biomass \(B_C\). rate change total carrion biomass simply difference rate carrion biomass produced rate consumed, \[ \frac{dB_C}{dt}=p_C - c_C\,B_C. \] discuss production rate \(p_C\) consumption rate \(c_CB_C\) .

title: Model description
text: steady state total carrion biomass per square meter \(B_C = 0.04651\) grams. chosen expected lifetime carrion biomass, .e., inverse mass-specific carrion consumption rate, equal 1 day.

title: Model description
text: Carrion consumed scavengers, also decomposed bacteria processes. rate carrion biomass consumed assumed proportional available carrion biomass. proportionality factor \(c_C\), refer “mass-specific consumption rate”, one component depends abundance consumers constant component \(d_C\) representing mass-specific rate decomposition. consumer species \(\), parameter \(\rho_i\) determines rate individuals species encounter carrion biomass. rate assumed scale size predator raised allometric exponent \(n\) taken scaling exponent maximum intake rate consumers, \[ E_{.C}(w)=\rho_i\, w^n\,B_C. \] Finally, satiation consumers taken account via feeding level \(f_i(w)\) described section consumption. gives mass-specific carrion consumption rate \[ c_C = \sum_i\int\rho_i\, w^n N_i(w) (1-f_i(w))\,dw + d_C. \] \(d_C\) mass-specific rate decomposition.

title: Model description
text: Skip Carrion production value mass-specific rate decomposition \(d_C=\) 233.1173648 per year. chosen production consumption equal chosen steady state abundances. parameters \(\rho_i\) units \(g^{-n}\) per year. non-zero species least scavenging.

title: Model description
text: rate \(p_C\) carrion biomass produced ecosystem contributions three sources, \[ p_C = p_{C.ext} + p_{C.g} + p_{C.d}, \] now discuss.

title: Model description
text: \(p_{C.ext}\) comes animals died natural causes predation (“external”): mizer model allows external mortality describe deaths natural causes due predation modelled species. external mortality include deaths lead carrion, also deaths due predation species explicitly modelled, example mammals sea birds. Thus proportion external mortality produces carrion. given carrion parameter ext_prop. \[   p_{C.ext} = \mathtt{ext\_prop}\,\sum_i\int\mu_{ext.}(w)N_i(w)w\,dw. \]

title: Model description
text: value ext_prop 0.1713287.

title: Model description
text: \(p_{C.g}\) comes animals killed fishing gear taken fishing vessel left dead sea. Thus \[ p_{C.g} = \sum_i\int\mu_{g.}N_i(w)w\,dw, \] excess gear mortality rate \(\mu_{g.}\) discussed @sec-excess-gear-mortality.

title: Model description
text: \(p_{C.d}\) comes discarding fished animals (“discards”): species parameter \(d_i\), called discard, gives proportion catch biomass discarded. biomass added carrion biomass. Thus \[   p_{C.d} = \sum_i\,d_i\int\mu_{f.}(w)N_i(w)w\,dw. \]

title: Model description
text: Skip Detritus

title: Model description
text: Detritus base benthic foodweb, providing food detritivores. Also small individuals species ingest detritus particles. describe detritus size-spectrum \(N_D(w)\), giving density detritus particles size \(w\), \(\int_w^{w+dw}N_D(w)dw\) number detritus particles size interval \([w,w+dw]\). However, know details size-specific dynamics detritus simply assume abundance described power law minimum size \(w_0\) maximum size \(w_{cutoff}\): \[ N_D(w) \propto \begin{cases} 0 & w < w_0\\ w^{-\lambda} & w_0\leq w\leq w_{cutoff}\\ 0 & w > w_{cutoff}\end{cases}. \] exponent \(\lambda\) kept fixed coefficient power law changes time reflect change total detritus biomass \[ B_D = \int_{w_{0}}^{w_{cutoff}} N_D(w)\, w \,dw. \] rate change total detritus biomass simply difference rate detritus biomass produced rate consumed, \[ \frac{dB_D}{dt}=p_D - c_D\,B_D. \] discuss production rate \(p_D\) consumption rate \(c_DB_D\) .

title: Model description
text: detritus spectrum stretches \(w_0=6\times 10^{-12}\) \(w_{cutoff}=0.001\) grams. power law exponent \(\lambda=2.05\). steady state total detritus biomass per square meter \(B_D = 254.5\) grams. chosen expected lifetime detritus biomass, .e., inverse mass-specific detritus consumption rate, 1 year.

title: Model description
text: rate detritus biomass consumed assumed proportional available detritus biomass. proportionality factor \(c_D\), refer “mass-specific consumption rate”, depends abundance consumers. consumption detritus modelled similarly consumption fish. First introduce rate predators species \(j\) consume detritus particles size \(w\): \[ \mu_{D}(w_p) = \sum_j  \theta_{jD}\int \phi_j(w,w_p) (1-f_j(w))   \gamma_j(w) N_j(w) \, dw. \] analogous predation mortality discussed earlier, \(\theta_{jD}\) determining strength species \(j\) feeds detritus. get total rate detritus consumption multiply weight detritus particle integrate detritus particles: \[ c_DB_D=\int_{w_0}^{w_{cutoff}}\mu_D(w_p)\,w_p\, N_D(w_p)\,dw_p. \] keep size-distribution detritus fixed, consumption rate proportional total detritus biomass \(B_D\), already indicated notation.

title: Model description
text: use value \(\theta_{jD}=\) 0.0112 predator species. Note mean species detritivores. species predation kernel detritus selected small individuals.

title: Model description
text: rate \(p_D\) carrion biomass produced ecosystem contributions three sources, \[ p_D = p_{D.f} + p_{D.c} + p_{D.ext}, \] now discuss.

title: Model description
text: \(p_{D.f}\) comes biomass consumed assimilated predators, .e., comes feces expelled predators. Let \(\alpha_i\) proportion consumed biomass assimilated species \(\) let \(f_i(w)\) feeding level \(E_i(w)\) food encounter rate discussed section consumption. \[ p_{D.f} = \sum_i(1-\alpha_i)\int (1-f_i(w))E_i(w)\,dw. \]

title: Model description
text: \(p_{D.c}\) comes decomposing carrion. discussed section carrion consumption, carrion biomass decomposed detritus rate \(d_CB_C\) \(d_C\) given fixed mass-specific decomposition rate \(B_C\) total carrion biomass. \[ p_{D.c}=d_CB_C. \]

title: Model description
text: \(p_{D.ext}\) rate detritus enters system external sources. mostly detritus sinking pelagic zone. rate model parameter independent model component.

title: Model description
text: value external detritus production rate \(p_{d.ext}=\) 136.5 grams per year. chosen production consumption equal chosen steady state abundances.

title: Carrion dynamics — carrion_dynamics
text: params MizerParams object n matrix current species abundances (species x size) n_other dynamic components. n_other$carrion used. rates list rates returned getRates() dt Time step size ... Unused

title: Carrion dynamics — carrion_dynamics
text: single number giving carrion biomass next time step

title: Carrion dynamics — carrion_dynamics
text: time evolution carrion biomass \(B\) described $$dB/dt = \tt{production} - \tt{consumption} * B$$ consumption mass-specific rate consumption due consumption calculated carrion_consumption_ms(), production rate rest system produces carrion biomass, calculated getCarrionProduction(). dynamical equation solved analytically $$B(t+dt) = B(t)\exp(-\tt{consumption} \cdot dt)   +\frac{\tt{production}}{\tt{consumption}}   (1-\exp(-\tt{consumption} \cdot dt)).$$ avoids stability problems arise used Euler method solve equation numerically.

title: Detritus consumption rate — detritus_consumption

title: Detritus dynamics — detritus_dynamics
text: Calculates detritus size spectrum next time step current size spectrum. size spectrum always held power law exponent -- intercept dynamical reflect change total detritus biomass.

title: Detritus dynamics — detritus_dynamics
code: detritus_dynamics(params, n, n_pp, n_other, rates, dt, ...)

title: Detritus dynamics — detritus_dynamics
text: params MizerParams object n matrix current species abundances (species x size) n_pp Vector detritus density n_other dynamic components. n_other$carrion used. rates list rates returned getRates() dt Time step size ... Unused

title: Detritus dynamics — detritus_dynamics
text: vector giving detritus spectrum next time step.

title: Detritus dynamics — detritus_dynamics
text: time evolution detritus biomass \(B\) described $$dB/dt = \tt{production} - \tt{consumption} * B + \tt{external}$$ consumption mass-specific rate consumption. production rate rest system produces detritus biomass. dynamical equation solved analytically $$B(t+dt) = B(t)\exp(-\tt{consumption} \cdot dt)   +\frac{\tt{production}}{\tt{consumption}}   (1-\exp(-\tt{consumption} \cdot dt)).$$ avoids stability problems arise used Euler method solve equation numerically.

title: Expected detritus lifetime — detritus_lifetime
text: expected detritus lifetime defined inverse mass-specific detritus consumption rate.

title: Expected detritus lifetime — detritus_lifetime
text: params MizerParams object value number new value expected lifetime years Assigning new value detritus lifetime rescales detritus abundance keeping total consumption detritus (adjusting interaction strength species detritus).

title: Expected detritus lifetime — detritus_lifetime
text: number giving expected lifetime years.

text: vector named entries "external", "gear_mort" "discards", given rate carrion biomass produced sources grams per year.

title: Carrion production rate — getCarrionProduction
text: animals died natural causes predation ("ext_mort"), animals killed fishing gear ("gear_mort"), discards fishing ("discards"). function returns vector individual contributions. can summed sum() get total production rate.

title: Detritus production rate — getDetritusProduction
text: Gives named vector rates different components ecosystem produce detritus: biomass assimilated predators ("feces"), decomposing carrion ("carrion"), pelagic zone ("external").

text: function returns vector individual contributions. can summed sum() get total production rate.

what:
mizerShelf: A mizer extension package for including detritus and carrion
components. — mizerShelf-package
title:
mizerShelf: A mizer extension package for including detritus and carrion
components. — mizerShelf-package
text: extension package mizer package (https://sizespectrum.org/mizer/) makes easy set mizer model detritus carrion component, thereby allowing realistic modelling benthic component fisheries continental shelf. package developed support creation exploration model fishery coast Northwest Mediterranean near Blanes forms basis paper "model size-spectrum dynamics estimate effects improving fisheries selectivity reducing discards Mediterranean mixed demersal fisheries".

title:
mizerShelf: A mizer extension package for including detritus and carrion
components. — mizerShelf-package

what: Plot the biomass of species and unstructured components through time — plotBiomass
title: Plot the biomass of species and unstructured components through time — plotBiomass
text: running projection, biomass species unstructured component can plotted time. biomass calculated within user defined size limits (min_w, max_w, min_l, max_l, see get_size_range_array()).

title: Plot the biomass of species and unstructured components through time — plotBiomass
code: plotBiomass(   sim,   species = NULL,   start_time,   end_time,   y_ticks = 6,   ylim = c(NA, NA),   total = FALSE,   background = TRUE,   highlight = NULL,   return_data = FALSE,   ... )  plotlyBiomass(   sim,   species = NULL,   start_time,   end_time,   y_ticks = 6,   ylim = c(NA, NA),   total = FALSE,   background = TRUE,   highlight = NULL,   ... )

title: Plot the biomass of species and unstructured components through time — plotBiomass
text: sim object class MizerSim species species selected. Optional. default target species selected. vector species names, numeric vector species indices, logical vector indicating species whether selected (TRUE) . start_time first time plotted. Default beginning time series. end_time last time plotted. Default end time series. y_ticks approximate number ticks desired y axis. ylim numeric vector length two providing lower upper limits y axis. Use NA refer existing minimum maximum. values 1e-20 always cut . total boolean value determines whether total biomass species plotted well. Default FALSE. background boolean value determines whether background species included. Ignored model contain background species. Default TRUE. highlight Name vector names species highlighted. return_data boolean value determines whether formatted data used plot returned instead plot . Default value FALSE

title: Plot the biomass of species and unstructured components through time — plotBiomass
text: ggplot2 object, unless return_data = TRUE, case data frame four variables 'Year', 'Biomass', 'Species', 'Legend' returned.

title: Plot the biomass of species and unstructured components through time — plotBiomass
code: # \donttest{ NWMed_sim <- project(NWMed_params, t_max = 15, effort = 0.6) #> Error in project(NWMed_params, t_max = 15, effort = 0.6): could not find function "project" plotBiomass(NWMed_sim, species = c("Hake", "Red mullet")) #> Error in getComponent(params, "carrion"): object 'params' not found plotBiomass(NWMed_sim, start_time = 5, end_time = 15) #> Error in getComponent(params, "carrion"): object 'params' not found  # Returning the data frame fr <- plotBiomass(NWMed_sim, return_data = TRUE) #> Error in getComponent(params, "carrion"): object 'params' not found str(fr) #> Error in str(fr): object 'fr' not found # }
